You might think I'm spouting nonsense here but hear me out. Basically all of the Democrats and Republicans pretending they're butting heads is just an act. Their goal is to make everyone think they're divided and focus on taking one side, while in reality they both will pass the exact same things. It's clear they collude together and it's all for deep state profit.

You'll notice how most of our "political" controversies are petty arguments over religion, college campuses, lgbt, television shows, social media, BLM, etc. that have absolutely nothing to do with politics. Yet the division works, and we find people strongly taking one side or the other...as both sides pass the exact same things! All the actual political arguments, like the economy, checks and balances, rights, etc. are either secondary or completely off the table. Think about it, there's a ton of things no one ever questions and if you do you're *immediately* dismissed as a lunatic:

* The federal government is the main decision maker in every aspect of life

* Very exhaustive k-12 academic indoctrination is a requirement

* Insanely restrictive ip laws prohibit even internet memes as a huge felony (more the fault of international organizations than the US)

* The federal government is very strong and can literally do whatever it wants as long as all the politicians agree

* We blindly listen to the elites and go through the system of school, college, 9-5 job, die

* Rights are considered outdated and "collective" interests are generally viewed as more important

* The government is the true owner of all your property and even your life, as it can dictate it and you even rent your land and income from them (taxes).

* The majority always rules and everyone must conform

* Everyone must vote Democrat or Republican, and if you don't vote the same as someone else you're their enemy

* Anyone who questions the system is just an whining idiot extremist who should not be listened to

There are plenty more things, but the point is all the actual political stuff is completely unanimous: full government totalitarian control to profit the deep state. All this show of the Republicans and Democrats supposedly hating each other is just a distraction. Wake up people, your candidates' "positions" are nothing more than their personal opinions. All the politicians vote for the exact same things. The US is just a one party state: the federalist party; that disguises itself as two to keep us sheep distracted from that fact.

parent.body:
Absolutely based post.

"How can we possibly do this?" Some may ask. Here's what I've been doing, as a guideline for anyone who should care to read. I don't have all of life's answers, but I know what has worked for me and changed my life dramatically over the past 5-6 years. My theory is based on Christian solidarity eventually morphing away from society's anti-Christ, hell-bound path, much like the Amish have, only with different views on technology, etc. You cannot reason with a cancer. You must separate from it, exactly like OP lays out. The things you can do to help that gradual change, and inspire those around you:

- Move away from corporate support. Buy local when possible. Learn to sew, learn to cook, just learn some basic skills to build up your own self-sufficiency and get off of Walmart and McDonald's teet. They don't need anymore $$$. Indoor farming is possible too, and rewarding. 
- Drop Hollywood. No more streaming, no movies, do not support cable networks and give them ratings. They peddle degeneracy 24/7. The lost in our country lap it up, but we don't have to participate.
- Drop major sports. They don't deserve the time or attention we give them, so they can turn around and lecture us about race-relations and public policy. They're already hurting, shown by viewership decline, revenue drops, and the option of advertising on uniforms where there wasn't previously. 
- Meet your neighbors. Build a community of Christ-like love and support for them. My neighbors barely speak English, but we share food and laughs and watch each other's backs 24/7.
- Build some wealth, and focus on personal responsibility. Do not worship debt and credit. Free yourself to prosper if you need to drop everything and move. I have worked on this for 3 years straight. It's not easy, but it's infinitely rewarding and liberating. I own my car. I have no credit card debt. I have a savings account that will help my wife and I live comfortably for at least 6 months, should things get wild. This took prayer, patience and discipline to achieve, but we're there.

Money and knowledge is power. When certain people wield and misuse that power, you get the past 80-100 years of what we've seen our country decline into....the central government is not your parent. It does not make you secure. It does not make you free. It only wants to feed itself, no matter who's in charge. Wake up and make yourself free. Help someone learn that they can be free. God wants your heart and mind free, not tied up in worry and despair every day of your life. We have a positive impact we can make all around us, we just need to take off the blinders first. 

Last thing: worry about your salvation first. Then your family's. Then your neighbor's. Do not compromise your beliefs for an ever-shifting clownworld of morals. Your roots need to be nurtured every day, so there's nothing an antichrist can do to come along and uproot you. And antichrists are all around us. They need to be exposed and avoided.

body:
> Wrong. Jesus said you're either with me or against me. We've tried the experiment of letting everyone play in our sandbox, and it doesn't work. We need to establish our own true Christian nation to stand alone, free from obfuscation and subversion.

Some jews used this argument to try and stop gentiles from being reached. They were prejudiced and *wanted* the gentiles to be lost. Similarly Jonah didn't want to minister to a race he didn't like, and he was swallowed by a whale and spit out on the shore of that country. You are showing the same contempt for certain peoples *you* don't like and want to keep them away. You are not only allowed, but *commanded* to shine light in the world. Secluding yourself and hating outsiders like the Amish do just shows a "stay away from us we're better than you you're not good enough to be around us" kind of pride. And pride is who's attitude?

> Read this a few times, and I'm not understanding what you mean. Can you clarify?

Classical literature and plays are often quoted. Most famously is Paul alluding to seeing through a glass darkly which is actually from Plato (though some dispute whether Paul wrote that passage). They referenced popular entertainment and literature to convey their ideas just as we do today.

> People have worshipped sports for too long. Evil in power has recognized and used that against us as a pacifier and distraction from what's important(life, family, church, etc.). It's evident in how rich these organizations have gotten. It's not even about the game anymore; it's all money, fame, power, idolization. Pure evil.

I don't get the obsession with watching a couple guys throw a ball around either. But if your argument is that the sports corporations are too rich, then you shouldn't do almost anything by that logic. Not even buy essentials, because most of them are made by rich companies. You might as well go completely off the grid.

> There's a reason big games are on Sundays, and I've always suspected it - pulling us from God. I used to be super guilty of it myself; for years, even.

They're usually Sunday evenings, while churches are usually Sunday morning.

> I'm saying build wealth to be free, but not just for your personal joy and safety, but so that you can help fund what you want to see in your community. "Money is power" is just an unfortunate fact, and we'll never be able to actually fight anything when evil, cruel people are all calling the shots.

Not being in debt doesn't require building up masses of wealth. Remember the rich man and Lazarus.

> Even on an airplane emergency you're supposed to put YOUR oxygen mask on before helping someone else. How can you help anyone when your salvation is not even established? That message is littered all through the New Testament. You are supposed to worry about you because only YOU know in your heart if you're saved. Then, of course, work to help save others. I am saved. I then led my girlfriend(wife now) to Christ. I am now working to witness to parts of both of our extended families.

Yes, logically it has to work like that. However I'm assuming that step is done, so now is the time to worry about others. Your original wording just made it sound like you should care about yourself before others.

> That is misled. Become all things to all people so you may win some.

Wrong. Jesus said you're either with me or against me. We've tried the experiment of letting everyone play in our sandbox, and it doesn't work. We need to establish our own true Christian nation to stand alone, free from obfuscation and subversion.

> You do realize many of the authors of biblical texts quoted from "secular entertainment" right?

Read this a few times, and I'm not understanding what you mean. Can you clarify?

> What do sports have to do with any of that? Aside from team name changes of course which you're not going to escape anywhere else.

Glad you asked. People have worshipped sports for too long. Evil in power has recognized and used that against us as a pacifier and distraction from what's important(life, family, church, etc.). It's evident in how rich these organizations have gotten. It's not even about the game anymore; it's all money, fame, power, idolization. Pure evil. Whether you are Drew Brees, Tim Tebow, LeBron James or even Jimmy Johnson, you are not a god. There's a reason big games are on Sundays, and I've always suspected it - pulling us from God. I used to be super guilty of it myself; for years, even.

> Are you saying we should become rich in this world and hoard money and expensive things, exactly what we're not supposed to do? (I may be misinterpreting you here because you say the opposite in the next paragraph).

Yes, it's a misinterpretation. I'm saying build wealth to be free, but not just for your personal joy and safety, but so that you can help fund what you want to see in your community. "Money is power" is just an unfortunate fact, and we'll never be able to actually fight anything when evil, cruel people are all calling the shots. If you're a slave to debt, you're not free. If everything in your house is financed, you don't own it!!

> That is the wrong order.

Bro, how? Even on an airplane emergency you're supposed to put YOUR oxygen mask on before helping someone else. How can you help anyone when your salvation is not even established? That message is littered all through the New Testament. You are supposed to worry about you because only YOU know in your heart if you're saved. Then, of course, work to help save others. I am saved. I then led my girlfriend(wife now) to Christ. I am now working to witness to parts of both of our extended families.

post.body:
In the US most states at least have summer, but otherwise cut breaks as short as they possibly can and and err on the side of longer days. On top of that teachers are encouraged to give as much homework as possible, most of it being busywork. Even worse, there is a push saying this isn't *enough* school and nearly all politicians and educational institutions unanimously support both extending the school day and school year even longer! In extreme cases there is talk about even making college compulsory or adding more grades. They're treating it like life or death if you don't spend every possible moment working on academia and having it drilled through your thick little skull. You are not allowed to question the compulsory school system or you're immediately dismissed as an extremist. Pretty soon even homeschooling and private schools will be outlawed and everyone must attend public school. I believe Trump recently passed something about basing government jobs on merit rather than amount of schooling, and even that was enough to cause a fuss.

In other powerful countries the situation is even worse, with no summer vacation and even longer school days. This includes China, Japan, England, and most of western Europe.

However in many smaller countries like Finland and Sweden, they not only have much longer breaks while retaining the full length of summer vacation, but they also only require school until 9th or 10th grade. These countries also have the highest academic scores, ironically. With all the extra spare time students are overall less stressed or burned out and have more time to focus on their future (which they'd better, they need to be quite successful to afford those sky high taxes). There's also more emphasis on electives and career goals rather than almost entirely academics.

So what is it with the obsession the more powerful countries have with academia and the "core subjects" as if they're the only thing that matters in life? As far as I'm aware Ron Paul is the only person in the US who ever questioned that system, and even he was forced to back down on it. I don't know about the other countries. It's an extremely inefficient institution and I don't see how even people in the US are so sternly "don't question it", as usually they hate government telling them what to do and paying taxes, even at 1/10000th of this level.

I hope that Christian's will come to realize the evils of democracy - a way that our ruling class makes us in part responsible in imposing their oppressive will on others. Realize that their federal reserve notes collected by their government will go to fund abortion, war, foreign tyranny's, subsidizing corporations, secretive agencies, etc... while their community infrastructure falls apart.

Free themselves from the bread and circus of society. Stop the excessive consumption of material goods and media. Live Simply.

I hope Christians realize that there has never been a time that their government has ever or will ever act in accordance with Christianity. There is nothing worth fighting for in a system that is inherently anti-Christ.

Just as those in the early Church, I hope Christians will come to resist by no longer participating. No more voting, no more taking out loans, no more paying taxes, no more consumption of media.
post.title: I hope for a day where Christians will abandon their governments

body:
True but:

* School does not teach and discourages creativity, which Europeans are still better at

* Americans also take languages (outside of school), and while it helps them understand sentences with simple words with some trouble, they can rarely speak it themselves, let alone flawlessly with little more effort than their native one. Yet most Europeans can do that.

* Most "brilliant minds" do not come from America. You can tell when talking to a foreigner online that their intelligence and creativity is usually above average for an American, education aside. They just seem to have better quality brains.

* On ruqqus and similar sites, which are dominated by Americans, Europeans make up a huge portion of the "top" users (interestingly there is quite a high number of female users in this group too, perhaps even a majority, even though in general these userbases are almost entirely male).

post.body:
I've noticed that Europeans tend to be more multi-talented, competent, and intelligent in my experience. They have a history of being more creative, for example literally all the famous artists and musicians. They tend to be more polite, more productive, and capable of learning more. For example most Europeans know 3+ languages and can speak all of them perfectly fluently, completely comfortably, whereas Americans can only speak English, and even if they learn another language they struggle to comfortably hold a conversation in it. They often can debate, do math, draw, play music, program, etc. very well more than the average American. The only thing Europeans don't have a monopoly on as far as I can tell is classic literature.

America is great and we have a better (notice I did not say good) government, more freedom, a better economy, and are the world's superpower, and without us the other countries couldn't survive. But I kinda feel like we as a whole are pretty stupid comparatively speaking. I don't think this is all laziness, because in America hard work seems to be a much bigger value, so I doubt it's any fault of our own. It's probably a genetic factor relating to our IQ that we can't control (which is very odd since most white Americans came from European ancestors, but it's what I've observed).

body:
They're insisting that people maintain their divisions according to certain attributes (not segregation or prejudice but rather "roles"), while the list they quoted from Paul is literally from a statement that those are part of the old law that has been superseded.

> Before the coming of this faith, we were held in custody under the law, locked up until the faith that was to come would be revealed. So the law was our guardian until Christ came that we might be justified by faith. Now that this faith has come, we are no longer under a guardian. So in Christ Jesus you are all children of God through faith, for all of you who were baptized into Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ. There is neither Jew nor Gentile, neither slave nor free, nor is there male and female, for you are all one in Christ Jesus. If you belong to Christ, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.

Paul said "There is neither Jew nor Gentile, neither slave nor free, nor is there male and female". The SBC used that same list to say there *is* "Jew and Gentile, slave and free, male and female". One of them has a history of being corrupted by politics and the other was a loving evangelist thought of highly among the original disciples. Which one do you believe?

body:
> They say "Humanity is primarily identified in Scripture as image bearers of God", which is the exact opposite of that. The Bible does reference male and female, Jew and Gentile, etc. sort of a lot. That's what they're referring to. The literal references. They're not saying that's only what defines people.

The "Humanity is primarily identified in Scripture as image bearers of God" bit is mostly just a disclaimer that they're not saying people are unequal. The only reason they have to bring up those references is if they're arguing that they should be purposefully maintained. And indeed, their next argument is: "That while we denounce the misuse of critical race theory and intersectionality, we do not deny that ethnic, gender, and cultural *distinctions* exist and are a gift from God that will give Him absolute glory when all humanity gathers around His throne in worship because of the redemption accomplished by our resurrected Lord". They are not talking about the fact that those things exist, they specifically said *distinctions*, and the former isn't much to argue about in the first place.

> Paul isn't speaking literally. He's speaking in relation to how those things exist relative to God, and how Christianity doesn't care about your race or gender. He didn't mean men and women don't exist, or that gender is a social construct created by the devil.

Yes he is saying exactly that. The whole context is about being free from the old law, and those dividing properties are one of the things he mentions that has passed away. And you admit that it is so relative to God, so why should you or me or the SBC treat it differently?

> Are you advocating for Critical Race Theory?

I still don't even know what that is. I'm advocating that race and other things shouldn't be much of a thought.
body_html:
They say "Humanity is primarily identified in Scripture as image bearers of God", which is the exact opposite of that. The Bible does reference male and female, Jew and Gentile, etc. sort of a lot. That's what they're referring to. The literal references. They're not saying that's only what defines people.

The "Humanity is primarily identified in Scripture as image bearers of God" bit is mostly just a disclaimer that they're not saying people are unequal. The only reason they have to bring up those references is if they're arguing that they should be purposefully maintained. And indeed, their next argument is: "That while we denounce the misuse of critical race theory and intersectionality, we do not deny that ethnic, gender, and cultural distinctions exist and are a gift from God that will give Him absolute glory when all humanity gathers around His throne in worship because of the redemption accomplished by our resurrected Lord". They are not talking about the fact that those things exist, they specifically said distinctions, and the former isn't much to argue about in the first place.

Paul isn't speaking literally. He's speaking in relation to how those things exist relative to God, and how Christianity doesn't care about your race or gender. He didn't mean men and women don't exist, or that gender is a social construct created by the devil.

Yes he is saying exactly that. The whole context is about being free from the old law, and those dividing properties are one of the things he mentions that has passed away. And you admit that it is so relative to God, so why should you or me or the SBC treat it differently?

Are you advocating for Critical Race Theory?

I still don't even know what that is. I'm advocating that race and other things shouldn't be much of a thought.
